lines.text: We got Ronnie "Sure Hands" Paulson, goddamn it!
The interview is going to be key for me, since I'm the type that comes across much better in person than on paper.
Oh, you do?
Girls like her are a dime a dozen. She's state school material at best.

[the mailman has dropped off a letter in the mailbox, while a dog bites at his leg]
Would you do me a favor and open it, please? I'm too nervous.
I'd love to.
[he opens the letter and reads it]
Marlon Browne? Congratulations.
I did it! I got into Ramsey! It's from Ramsey?
No, it's from Ed McMahon. You may have already won ten million dollars.
At Ramsey, we're looking beyond the numbers.

[inside a booth at a college recruiting fair]
Welcome to the Arcadia Bible Academy! Last night, Jesus Christ came down to me on a vision in a flaming pie! He said, I want... what's your name?
Marlon.
Marlon! I want Marlon to attend the Arcadia Bible Academy. Paying full tuition, of course. Son... Jesus *loves* you.
He might not if he saw my SAT scores.
They're low?
Yeah.
All right.
[he pats Marlon on the shoulder, Marlon leaves the booth]
Jesus!
I wish they'd tattoo their SAT scores across their forehead. At least that would make my decision easier.
People choose colleges for all kinds of idiotic reasons, like fraternities and Slavic language departments.
That's the beauty of the Bauer/Bennedict method. You see, you don't have to understand us... just trust us!
Why should I spend $10,000 for you to go to Ramsey when you can go to Michigan for five? What, is the football team five times cuter? You'll get an education that's five times better?
I'll get a job and I've already investigated student loans.
There's been a big change with student loans. They want to get paid back!

[about the SAT test]
Guessing cannot hurt you. You have the B&B guarantee on that. Just close your eyes and point.
Marlon's a great kid, really. He just needs time to develop. Like a fine wine.
Two men, A and B, are trapped inside my mailbox chained to 200,000 pounds of explosives.
This isn't funny!
What test is this?
If their chains are three inches thick and they have thirty seconds to escape, sawing at one inch per second, what are their chances for survival?
Skip it! Go to the next problem!
Come on, man! Get us out of here!
Who cares? I already got into college.

[about Marlon's video]
Now I know this kid seems hopeless. But you've gotta look at this video. I've seen it and I think he's really got something.
Better be a union card.
Forget this "go to college" crap!
[last lines]
There's always graduate school!
I can't believe we're breaking and entering into the college we want to get into.
The thing about Ramsey, Dad, is that they actually consider people like me.
What does that mean? They're looking for someone with a definitive collection of Silver Surfer comic books?
